segment.source: WebSockets provide a mechanism for fast, secure two-way communication between a client and a server over the web using HTTP(S).
segment.target: WebSockets provide a mechanism for fast, secure two-way communication between a client and a server over the web using HTTP(S).

segment.source: WebSockets
segment.target: WebSockets

segment.source: WebSockets
segment.target: WebSockets

segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: Important APIs
segment.target: Important APIs

segment.source: MessageWebSocket
segment.target: MessageWebSocket

segment.source: StreamWebSocket
segment.target: StreamWebSocket

segment.source: WebSockets provide a mechanism for fast, secure two-way communication between a client and a server over the web using HTTP(S).
segment.target: WebSockets provide a mechanism for fast, secure two-way communication between a client and a server over the web using HTTP(S).

segment.source: Under the WebSocket Protocol, data is transferred immediately over a full-duplex single socket connection, allowing messages to be sent and received from both endpoints in real time.
segment.target: Under the WebSocket Protocol, data is transferred immediately over a full-duplex single socket connection, allowing messages to be sent and received from both endpoints in real time.

segment.source: WebSockets are ideal for use in real-time gaming where instant social network notifications and up-to-date displays of information (game statistics ) need to be secure and use fast data transfer.
segment.target: WebSockets are ideal for use in real-time gaming where instant social network notifications and up-to-date displays of information (game statistics ) need to be secure and use fast data transfer.

segment.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) developers can use the MessageWebSocket and StreamWebSocket classes to connect with servers that support the Websocket protocol.
segment.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) developers can use the MessageWebSocket and StreamWebSocket classes to connect with servers that support the Websocket protocol.

segment.source: MessageWebSocket
segment.target: MessageWebSocket

segment.source: StreamWebSocket
segment.target: StreamWebSocket

segment.source: Suitable for typical scenarios where messages are not extremely large.
segment.target: Suitable for typical scenarios where messages are not extremely large.

segment.source: Suitable for scenarios in which large files (such as photos or videos) are being transferred.
segment.target: Suitable for scenarios in which large files (such as photos or videos) are being transferred.

segment.source: Enables notification that an entire WebSocket message has been received.
segment.target: Enables notification that an entire WebSocket message has been received.

segment.source: Allows sections of a message to be read with each read operation.
segment.target: Allows sections of a message to be read with each read operation.

segment.source: Supports both UTF-8 and binary messages.
segment.target: Supports both UTF-8 and binary messages.

segment.source: Supports only binary messages.
segment.target: Supports only binary messages.

segment.source: Similar to a UDP or datagram socket.
segment.target: Similar to a UDP or datagram socket.

segment.source: Similar to a TCP or stream socket.
segment.target: Similar to a TCP or stream socket.

segment.source: In most cases you'll want to use a secure WebSocket connection to encrypt data sent and received.
segment.target: In most cases you'll want to use a secure WebSocket connection to encrypt data sent and received.

segment.source: This will also increase the chances that your connection will succeed, as many proxies will reject unencrypted WebSocket connections.
segment.target: This will also increase the chances that your connection will succeed, as many proxies will reject unencrypted WebSocket connections.

segment.source: The WebSocket protocol defines the following two URI schemes.
segment.target: The WebSocket protocol defines the following two URI schemes.

segment.source: ws: - use for unencrypted connections.
segment.target: ws: - use for unencrypted connections.

segment.source: wss: - use for secure connections that should be encrypted.
segment.target: wss: - use for secure connections that should be encrypted.

segment.source: To encrypt a WebSocket connection, use the wss: URI scheme, for example, .
segment.target: To encrypt a WebSocket connection, use the wss: URI scheme, for example, .

segment.source: Using MessageWebSocket
segment.target: Using MessageWebSocket

segment.source: The MessageWebSocket allows sections of a message to be read with each read operation.
segment.target: The MessageWebSocket allows sections of a message to be read with each read operation.

segment.source: A MessageWebSocket is typically used in scenarios where messages are not extremely large.
segment.target: A MessageWebSocket is typically used in scenarios where messages are not extremely large.

segment.source: Both UTF-8 and binary files are supported.
segment.target: Both UTF-8 and binary files are supported.

segment.source: The code in this section creates a new MessageWebSocket, connects to a WebSocket server, and sends data to the server.
segment.target: The code in this section creates a new MessageWebSocket, connects to a WebSocket server, and sends data to the server.

segment.source: Once a successful connection is established, the app waits for the MessageWebSocket.MessageReceived event to be triggered, indicating that data was received.
segment.target: Once a successful connection is established, the app waits for the MessageWebSocket.MessageReceived event to be triggered, indicating that data was received.

segment.source: This sample uses the WebSocket.org echo server, a service which simply echoes back to the sender any string sent to it.
segment.target: This sample uses the WebSocket.org echo server, a service which simply echoes back to the sender any string sent to it.

segment.source: By using the "wss:" protocol specifier, this sample uses a secure connection to send and receive messages.
segment.target: By using the "wss:" protocol specifier, this sample uses a secure connection to send and receive messages.

segment.source: Once you have initialized the WebSocket connection, your code must perform the following activities to properly send and receive data.
segment.target: Once you have initialized the WebSocket connection, your code must perform the following activities to properly send and receive data.

segment.source: Implement a callback for the MessageWebSocket.MessageReceived event
segment.target: Implement a callback for the MessageWebSocket.MessageReceived event

segment.source: Before establishing a connection and sending data with a WebSocket, your app needs to register an event callback to receive notification when data is received.
segment.target: Before establishing a connection and sending data with a WebSocket, your app needs to register an event callback to receive notification when data is received.

segment.source: When the MessageWebSocket.MessageReceived event occurs, the registered callback is called and receives data from MessageWebSocketMessageReceivedEventArgs.
segment.target: When the MessageWebSocket.MessageReceived event occurs, the registered callback is called and receives data from MessageWebSocketMessageReceivedEventArgs.

segment.source: This example is written with the assumption that the messages being sent are in UTF-8 format.
segment.target: This example is written with the assumption that the messages being sent are in UTF-8 format.

segment.source: The following sample function receives a string from a connected WebSocket server and prints the string to the debugger output window.
segment.target: The following sample function receives a string from a connected WebSocket server and prints the string to the debugger output window.

segment.source: Implement a callback for the MessageWebSocket.Closed event
segment.target: Implement a callback for the MessageWebSocket.Closed event

segment.source: Before establishing a connection and sending data with a WebSocket, your app needs to register an event callback to receive notification when the WebSocket is closed by the WebSocket server.
segment.target: Before establishing a connection and sending data with a WebSocket, your app needs to register an event callback to receive notification when the WebSocket is closed by the WebSocket server.

segment.source: When the MessageWebSocket.Closed event occurs, the registered callback is called to indicate the connection was closed by the WebSocket server.
segment.target: When the MessageWebSocket.Closed event occurs, the registered callback is called to indicate the connection was closed by the WebSocket server.

segment.source: Send a message on a WebSocket
segment.target: Send a message on a WebSocket

segment.source: Once a connection is established, the WebSocket client can send data to the server.
segment.target: Once a connection is established, the WebSocket client can send data to the server.

segment.source: The DataWriter.StoreAsync method returns a parameter that maps to an unsigned int.
segment.target: The DataWriter.StoreAsync method returns a parameter that maps to an unsigned int.

segment.source: This changes how we define the task to send the message compared with the task to make the connection.
segment.target: This changes how we define the task to send the message compared with the task to make the connection.

segment.source: Note When you create a new DataWriter object using the MessageWebSocket's OutputStream, the DataWriter takes ownership of the OutputStream, and will deallocate the Outputstream when the DataWriter goes out of scope.
segment.target: Note When you create a new DataWriter object using the MessageWebSocket's OutputStream, the DataWriter takes ownership of the OutputStream, and will deallocate the Outputstream when the DataWriter goes out of scope.

segment.source: This causes any subsequent attempts to use the OutputStream to fail with an HRESULT value of 0x80000013.
segment.target: This causes any subsequent attempts to use the OutputStream to fail with an HRESULT value of 0x80000013.

segment.source: To avoid deallocating the OutputStream, this code calls the DataWriter's DetachStream method, which returns ownership of the stream to the WebSocket object.
segment.target: To avoid deallocating the OutputStream, this code calls the DataWriter's DetachStream method, which returns ownership of the stream to the WebSocket object.

segment.source: The following function sends the given string to a connected WebSocket, and prints a verification message in the debugger output window.
segment.target: The following function sends the given string to a connected WebSocket, and prints a verification message in the debugger output window.

segment.source: Using advanced controls with WebSockets
segment.target: Using advanced controls with WebSockets

segment.source: MessageWebSocket and StreamWebSocket follow the same model for using advanced controls.
segment.target: MessageWebSocket and StreamWebSocket follow the same model for using advanced controls.

segment.source: Corresponding with each of the above primary classes are related classes to access advanced controls.
segment.target: Corresponding with each of the above primary classes are related classes to access advanced controls.

segment.source: MessageWebSocketControl provides socket control data on a MessageWebSocket object.
segment.target: MessageWebSocketControl provides socket control data on a MessageWebSocket object.

segment.source: StreamWebSocketControl provides socket control data on a StreamWebSocket object.
segment.target: StreamWebSocketControl provides socket control data on a StreamWebSocket object.

segment.source: The basic model to use advanced controls is the same for both types of WebSockets.
segment.target: The basic model to use advanced controls is the same for both types of WebSockets.

segment.source: The following discussion uses a StreamWebSocket as an example, but the same process can be used with a MessageWebSocket.
segment.target: The following discussion uses a StreamWebSocket as an example, but the same process can be used with a MessageWebSocket.

segment.source: Create the StreamWebSocket object.
segment.target: Create the StreamWebSocket object.

segment.source: Use the StreamWebSocket.Control property to retrieve the StreamWebSocketControl instance associated with this StreamWebSocket object.
segment.target: Use the StreamWebSocket.Control property to retrieve the StreamWebSocketControl instance associated with this StreamWebSocket object.

segment.source: Get or set properties on the StreamWebSocketControl instance to get or set specific advanced controls.
segment.target: Get or set properties on the StreamWebSocketControl instance to get or set specific advanced controls.

segment.source: Both StreamWebSocket and MessageWebSocket impose requirements on when advanced controls can be set.
segment.target: Both StreamWebSocket and MessageWebSocket impose requirements on when advanced controls can be set.

segment.source: For all advanced controls on the StreamWebSocket, the app must always set the property before issuing a Connect operation.
segment.target: For all advanced controls on the StreamWebSocket, the app must always set the property before issuing a Connect operation.

segment.source: Because of this requirement, it is best practice to set all control properties immediately after creating the StreamWebSocket object.
segment.target: Because of this requirement, it is best practice to set all control properties immediately after creating the StreamWebSocket object.

segment.source: Do not try to set a control property after the StreamWebSocket.ConnectAsync method has been called.
segment.target: Do not try to set a control property after the StreamWebSocket.ConnectAsync method has been called.

segment.source: For all of the advanced controls on the MessageWebSocket except the message type, you must set the property before issuing a Connect operation.
segment.target: For all of the advanced controls on the MessageWebSocket except the message type, you must set the property before issuing a Connect operation.

segment.source: It is best practice to set all control properties immediately after creating the MessageWebSocket object.
segment.target: It is best practice to set all control properties immediately after creating the MessageWebSocket object.

segment.source: Except for the message type, do not attempt to change a control property after MessageWebSocket.ConnectAsync has been called.
segment.target: Except for the message type, do not attempt to change a control property after MessageWebSocket.ConnectAsync has been called.

segment.source: WebSocket information classes
segment.target: WebSocket information classes

segment.source: MessageWebSocket and StreamWebSocket each have a corresponding class that provides additional information about a WebSocket instance.
segment.target: MessageWebSocket and StreamWebSocket each have a corresponding class that provides additional information about a WebSocket instance.

segment.source: MessageWebSocketInformation provides information about a MessageWebSocket, and you retrieve an instance of the information class using the MessageWebSocket.Information property.
segment.target: MessageWebSocketInformation provides information about a MessageWebSocket, and you retrieve an instance of the information class using the MessageWebSocket.Information property.

segment.source: StreamWebSocketInformation provides information about a StreamWebSocket, and you retrieve an instance of the information class using the StreamWebSocket.Information property.
segment.target: StreamWebSocketInformation provides information about a StreamWebSocket, and you retrieve an instance of the information class using the StreamWebSocket.Information property.

segment.source: Note that all of the properties on both Information classes are read-only, and that you can retrieve current information at any time during the lifetime of a web socket object.
segment.target: Note that all of the properties on both Information classes are read-only, and that you can retrieve current information at any time during the lifetime of a web socket object.

segment.source: Handling network exceptions
segment.target: Handling network exceptions

segment.source: An error encountered on a MessageWebSocket or StreamWebSocket operation is returned as an HRESULT value.
segment.target: An error encountered on a MessageWebSocket or StreamWebSocket operation is returned as an HRESULT value.

segment.source: The WebSocketError.GetStatus method is used to convert a network error from a WebSocket operation to a WebErrorStatus enumeration value.
segment.target: The WebSocketError.GetStatus method is used to convert a network error from a WebSocket operation to a WebErrorStatus enumeration value.

segment.source: Most of the WebErrorStatus enumeration values correspond to an error returned by the native HTTP client operation.
segment.target: Most of the WebErrorStatus enumeration values correspond to an error returned by the native HTTP client operation.

segment.source: Your app can filter on specific WebErrorStatus enumeration values to modify app behavior depending on the cause of the exception.
segment.target: Your app can filter on specific WebErrorStatus enumeration values to modify app behavior depending on the cause of the exception.

segment.source: For parameter validation errors, an app can also use the HRESULT from the exception to learn more detailed information on the error that caused the exception.
segment.target: For parameter validation errors, an app can also use the HRESULT from the exception to learn more detailed information on the error that caused the exception.

segment.source: Possible HRESULT values are listed in the Winerror.h header file.
segment.target: Possible HRESULT values are listed in the Winerror.h header file.

segment.source: For most parameter validation errors, the HRESULT returned is E\_INVALIDARG.
segment.target: For most parameter validation errors, the HRESULT returned is E\_INVALIDARG.

segment.source: Setting timeouts on WebSocket operations
segment.target: Setting timeouts on WebSocket operations

segment.source: The MessageWebSocket and StreamWebSocket classes uses an internal system service to send WebSocket client requests and receive responses from a server.
segment.target: The MessageWebSocket and StreamWebSocket classes uses an internal system service to send WebSocket client requests and receive responses from a server.

segment.source: The default timeout value used for a WebSocket connect operation is 60 seconds.
segment.target: The default timeout value used for a WebSocket connect operation is 60 seconds.

segment.source: If the HTTP server that supports WebSockets is temporarily down or blocked by a network outage and the server doesn't or can't respond to the WebSocket connection request, the internal system service waits the default 60 seconds before it returns an error which causes an exception to be thrown on the WebSocket ConnectAsync method.
segment.target: If the HTTP server that supports WebSockets is temporarily down or blocked by a network outage and the server doesn't or can't respond to the WebSocket connection request, the internal system service waits the default 60 seconds before it returns an error which causes an exception to be thrown on the WebSocket ConnectAsync method.

segment.source: If the name query for an HTTP server name in the URI returns multiple IP addresses for the name, the internal system service tries up to 5 IP addresses for the site each with a default timeout of 60 seconds before it fails.
segment.target: If the name query for an HTTP server name in the URI returns multiple IP addresses for the name, the internal system service tries up to 5 IP addresses for the site each with a default timeout of 60 seconds before it fails.

segment.source: An app making a WebSocket connection request could wait several minutes trying to connect to multiple IP addresses before an error is returned and an exception is thrown.
segment.target: An app making a WebSocket connection request could wait several minutes trying to connect to multiple IP addresses before an error is returned and an exception is thrown.

segment.source: This behavior could appear to the user as if the app stopped working.
segment.target: This behavior could appear to the user as if the app stopped working.

segment.source: The default timeout used for send and receive operations after a WebSocket connection has been established is 30 seconds.
segment.target: The default timeout used for send and receive operations after a WebSocket connection has been established is 30 seconds.

segment.source: To make your app more responsive and minimize these issues, it can set a shorter timeout on connection requests so that the operation fails due to timeout sooner than from the default settings.
segment.target: To make your app more responsive and minimize these issues, it can set a shorter timeout on connection requests so that the operation fails due to timeout sooner than from the default settings.

segment.source: You set timeouts similarly for both StreamWebSockets and MessageWebSockets.
segment.target: You set timeouts similarly for both StreamWebSockets and MessageWebSockets.

segment.source: The following example shows how to set a timeout on StreamWebSocket, but the process is similar for a MessageWebSocket.
segment.target: The following example shows how to set a timeout on StreamWebSocket, but the process is similar for a MessageWebSocket.

segment.source: Create a task that completes after a specified delay using a timer.
segment.target: Create a task that completes after a specified delay using a timer.

segment.source: Create a task for the WebSocket operation with a cancellation\_token\_source to support cancellation.
segment.target: Create a task for the WebSocket operation with a cancellation\_token\_source to support cancellation.

segment.source: If the task with the specified timeout delay completes before the WebSocket connect operation, cancel the task for the WebSocket operation.
segment.target: If the task with the specified timeout delay completes before the WebSocket connect operation, cancel the task for the WebSocket operation.

segment.source: The following example creates one task that completes after a specified delay, and creates a second task that cancels after a specified delay.
segment.target: The following example creates one task that completes after a specified delay, and creates a second task that cancels after a specified delay.

segment.source: These classes can be used with StreamWebSocket and MessageWebSocket when trying to establish a connection to set a specific timeout.
segment.target: These classes can be used with StreamWebSocket and MessageWebSocket when trying to establish a connection to set a specific timeout.

segment.source: An example usage would be calling the StreamWebSocket.ConnectAsync method in a task with a cancellation\_token\_source that supports cancellation.
segment.target: An example usage would be calling the StreamWebSocket.ConnectAsync method in a task with a cancellation\_token\_source that supports cancellation.

segment.source: If timeout completes first, then the cancellation\_token\_source is used to cancel the task for the WebSocket connect operation.
segment.target: If timeout completes first, then the cancellation\_token\_source is used to cancel the task for the WebSocket connect operation.
